bioghist.p: The Culver family included Rev. Theodore B. Culver, Annie W. Culver (possibly Mrs. Theodore B. Culver), Rev. Andrew Culver (possibly Theodore's father), and Annie Culver Boyd, wife of Rev. William Boyd and daughter of Andrew Culver and Sarah White.

scopecontent.p: This collection contains correspondence and reports from the 1920s to 1940s. The correspondence to the Culvers, most of which is addressed to Mrs. Culver (Annie), is from various Chinese missions and missionaries, most notably from the North China Presbyterian Mission in Peking. Correspondents include Florence Logan, Mrs. J. P. Leynse, Ruth E. Dean and Helen P. Scott. Also included are photographs and negatives of churches and mission schools, students, missionaries, some general scenes of villages, towns, and people, and family photographs of Culvers and Boyds as well as postcards. There are also notes for sermons; a volume of marriage records (1848-1864); funeral records; letters from Chinese church members; materials related to Culver's time at Grace Presbyterian Church (Philadelphia), including newsletters (1907-1911) and parishioner lists; and a small amount of material related to Ashbourne Church. The collection contains oversize maps and broadsides and one oversize photograph.
